title: Ticket #3386: RFE: GPU discovery and ClassAd Update
description:
Run code to find GPUs, discover properties, and update the ClassAd.

We would like to enable HTCondor to discover GPUs present on a machine, in particular NVIDIA GPUs, discover some properties about these GPUs, and then advertise these properties in the machine ClassAd.

ToddT and Zi wrote a code to discover these properties and we want to have this code run to advertise these properties. To do this, we have a test machine, gpu-2.chtc.wisc.edu, that we can use for testing purposes. We also want to use Daemon ClassAd Hooks to perform this advertising.
remarks:
2013-Jan-22 15:34:56 by samf:
The goal of this code is to discover whether or not there is a GPU on the machine. If there is, then advertise that fact. Additionally, we should run, using the startd_cron hooks to advertise GPU attributes in the MachineClassAd. condor_gpu_discovery needs to have a command line argument of -dynamic and/or -static for the code to work correctly. All GPU_ prefixes can be printed as GPU0_, GPU1_, GPU2_ ... to represent the statuses of each GPU. This code will compile on machines without the CUDA libraries or NVML, the NVIDIA Management Library. Currently, we have are still working on the conditional running of this code for advertisement purposes.

The code will provide when given a static flag something like: 

GPU_CudaDrv=DriverVersion
GPU_CudaRun=RuntimeVersion
GPU_Dev=Dev
GPU_Name=DevicePropertyName
GPU_Capability=DevicePropMajor.DevicePropMinor
GPU_GlobalMemMB=DevicePropTotalGlobalMem
GPU_NumSMs=DevicePropMultiProcessorCount
GPU_NumCores=DevicePropMultiProcessorCount*Function(DevicePropMajor, DevicePropMinor)
GPU_ClockGhz=DevicePropClockRate

The code will provide when given a dynamic flag (which will require NVML): 

GPU_DisplayEnabled=True/False
GPU_PersistenceEnabled=True/False
GPU_PowerCappingEnabled=True/False (Not currently enabled)
GPU_EccEnabled=True/False
GPU_FanSpeedPct=Percentage
GPU_PowerUsage=Number
GPU_BoardTempF=Temperature (Not currently enabled)
GPU_DieTempF=Temperature
GPU_EccErrorsSingleBit=Bit
GPU_EccErrorsDoubleBit=Bit

The code will provide when given a static flag (used when compiled with -DTEST): 

GPU_CudaDrv=4.20
GPU_CudaRun=4.10
GPU_Dev=Device_Number
GPU_Name="GeForce GTX 480"
GPU_Capability=2.0
GPU_GlobalMemMB=1536
GPU_NumSMs=15
GPU_NumCores=480
GPU_ClockGhz=1.40

and for a dynamic flag 

GPU_FanSpeedPct=44
GPU_DieTempF=52

When this code is run on a machine with a gpu (e.g. gpu-2.chtc.wisc.edu), I get:
